channel.title: Posts on R-Ladies East Lansing
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on R-Ladies East Lansing

item.title: 2019: Upcoming Events
item.description: A little background R-Ladies East Lansing welcomes R-enthusiasts of all proficiency levels, including aspiring and experienced R programmers, who are interested in mentoring, networking & expertise upskilling. This non-profit, civil society community is designed to develop membersâ€™ R skills & knowledge through social, collaborative learning & sharing. Supporting minority identity access to STEM skills & careers, the Free Software Movement, and contributing to the global R community! Anyone and everyone interested in R/Data Science should join the group.

item.title: 2018: Year in Review
item.description: Thanks to everyone who attended, participated or sponsored R-Ladies East Lansing in 2018! We had a fantastic start & a very successful first 6mo on campus! We hosted 7 meetups since July 2018 including two very well-attended workshops (70+ attendees) and a DataViz challenge! Help us continue spreading the R & Data Science spirit across MSU in 2019! Contact us eastlansing@rladies.org about co-hosting or sponsoring a meetup/workshop in Spring 2019.

item.title: Challenge: DataViz
item.description: Coming up soon… How to be in touch? Access our presentations, R scripts and more on Github & Google Drive, and follow us on twitter to stay up to date about R-Ladies news! Join the Meetup group to be notified of our upcoming meetings! The Team Organizers: Janani Ravi, Camille Archer Co-organizers: Kayla Johnson, Arjun Krishnan (~ Krishnan Lab) R-Ladies Global Meetup: https://meetup.com/rladies-east-lansing/ Twitter: @RLadiesELansing & @RLadiesGlobal Slack: https://rladies-eastlansing.

item.title: Lightning Talks: Part III
item.description: A great set of talks to conlude our lightning talk series! Spatial Humanities w/ R by Rachael White R/qtl by Miranda Haus Hyenas, Microbes & R by Connie Rojas Publication quality figures w/ #ggpubr by Taylor Dunivin R+LaTeX=knitr by Cara Feldscher ðŸ’°Thank you Krishnan Lab (@KrishnanLab) CMSE & BMB, Michigan State University. Hosts: Janani Ravi & Camille Archer

item.title: Lightning Talks: Part II
item.description: We had such an amazing line up of talks for our second session! Morphospaces w/ #Geomorph by Acacia Ackles Integrating Python & R w/ #Reticulate by Anna Yannakopoulos Literature Survey w/ #Bibliometrix by Veronica Frans GLM w/ #glmulti by Lauren Wisnieski Cool #dataviz resources Data-to-Viz RGraph Gallery by Janani Ravi ðŸ’°Special thanks to College Of Veterinary Medicine (@MSUVets), Michigan State University. Hosts: Janani Ravi & Camille Archer

item.title: Lightning Talks: Part I
item.description: Our inaugural round of lightning talks by: Git & R by Melissa Dale Experimental languages w/ R by Ni-La Le Having fun w/ Rcade by Kayla Johnson Websites w/ R by Camille Archer UpSet plots w/ R & by Janani Ravi Conference promo by Big Data Ignite. ðŸ’°Thanks again BEACON Center, MSU (@BEACON_Center) Hosts: Janani Ravi & Camille Archer

item.title: 2018: KickOff Meeting!
item.description: On a cool Monday evening in late July almost 40 women (and a few brave men) gathered at Michigan State University’s campus to kickoff the R-Ladies East Lansing Chapter. The group included women in industry and academia who were using the R-language (or planning to use it) for a variety of applications including computer science, human health, earth sciences, political science, statistics and finance. Over pizza and pop the group warmed up with introductions and engaged in discussions about their R-interests.

item.title: Launching R-Ladies East Lansing!
item.description: Welcome to our new chapter! What weâ€™re about R-Ladies East Lansing is a local chapter of R-Ladies Global. We meet to discuss, learn, teach, present, work on all things R! Our priority is to provide a safe community space for anyone identifying as a minority gender who is interested in and/or working with R. The group exists to promote gender diversity in the R community worldwide. We are pro-actively inclusive of queer, trans, and all minority identities, with additional sensitivity to intersectional identities.
